DataElement.preferredName: Legs Plaque Body Surface Area Importance Weight Product Value
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Calculated value representing the weighted plaque score multiplied by the area score for plaque occurring on the legs.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Legs Plaque Body Surface Area Importance Weight Product Product
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: One of the two lower extremities in humans used for locomotion and support._Abnormal tissue that results from the progressive accumulation or deposit of certain substances in a body cavity, surface, or lumen._A measure of the 2-dimensional extent of the body surface (i.e., the skin). Body surface area (BSA) can be calculated by mathematical formula or from a chart that relates height to weight. BSA is often an important factor in dosing._The relative importance granted to something._A quantity obtained by multiplication.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: One of the two lower extremities in humans used for locomotion and support.:Abnormal tissue that results from the progressive accumulation or deposit of certain substances in a body cavity, surface, or lumen.

Concepts.definition: The portion of the lower extremity between the knee and the ankle. For clinical purposes this term is also used to refer to the whole inferior limb.
Abnormal tissue that results from the progressive accumulation or deposit of certain substances in a body cavity, surface, or lumen.

Concepts.definition: A measure of the 2-dimensional extent of the body surface (i.e., the skin).  Body surface area (BSA) can be calculated by mathematical formula or from a chart that relates height to weight.  BSA is often an important factor in dosing.
The relative importance granted to something.
